org.opengrok.indexer.util

Class AbstractObjectPool<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opengrok.indexer.util.AbstractObjectPool<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of pooled objects.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    ObjectPool<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BoundedBlockingObjectPool

    public abstract class AbstractObjectPool<T>
extends Object
implements ObjectPool<T>
    Represents an abstract implementation of ObjectPool that defines the procedure of returning an object to the pool.
    Author:
    Swaranga

    • Method Detail

      • release

        public final void release(T t)
        Returns the object to the pool. The method first validates the object if it is re-usable and then puts returns it to the pool. If the object validation fails, handleInvalidReturn(java.lang.Object) is called. Some implementations will try to create a new object and put it into the pool; however this behaviour is subject to change from implementation to implementation.
        Specified by:
        release in interface ObjectPool<T>
        Parameters:
        t - the object to return to the pool

      • handleInvalidReturn
